sub_title: ‎Proficio (CEO) Consultant International Matchmaking, Trade, Institutional Dev. and Strategic Planning, Electric Driving
summary:
Cees Grootes / Kees Grootes

▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬
► Contact: cgrootes  @  gmail.com 
► If I don't know you, explain why I should; why we both could professionally benefit.
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬

Information & Management Consultant with international (expatriate) teamleader experience in a.o. foreign aid and technical assistance programmes.

My passion is to challenge organizations, teams & individuals and not the least myself, to skip routine and to become far more creative in finding management solutions and planning strategies

As on-site Management and Information Consultant, I have over 25 years of practical, consulting and research experience, and a proven didactic record as an informative, theoretical, methodological and practical trainer. Over years I became a cross-functional implementor and accomplished (on site) change agent in multi disciplinary, socially mixed environments.

My long-term and short-term assignments for the private sector, the public sector and universities have been both in western and developing countries. While living for extended periods in the Caribbean, Europe and Asia, and as a result of extensive traveling, I developed a profound cultural interest.

In developing countries I worked in the public sector (with fundamental links to the private sector; such as Chambers of Commerce) on top-national and regional level for, and in cooperation with, the major bilateral and multi-lateral donor agencies for development (foreign aid) programs such as: ADB, FAO, FINNIDA, GTZ, IFAD, ILO, JICA, The Netherlands Govt., NORAD, SACEP, SIDA, WorldBank (WB), UNDP, UNICEF, UNIDO

Specialties: Teamleader competence to run, administer & supervise medium size foreign aid development projects:

1. Management & Institutional Development
2. Management Information - Information Management
3. Strategic (Policy) Planning & Analysis
4. Applied Social Research - Research methodology - Statistics
5. Monitoring & Evaluation
6. Chambers of Commerce development & SME dev.
7. Computers, Internet, Software, Networks
8. IT / SPSS / Social Media
9. Website development / Hosting / Domainreseller

projects:
[{'title': 'International Business Advisory Board member, Passport 2 Trade 2.0 project ( #p2t2 )', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'As volunteer advisory board member for The Netherlands I provide project feedback to the Salford Business School, (University of Salford, Manchester, United Kingdom) and the Institute for Information Systems Research at University of Koblenz-Landau (Germany).

The Passport to Trade 2.0 project explores 31 EU countries and identifies different business cultures and attitudes to Social Media as well as Student Placements.

The aim of this project is to transfer the innovation of the P2T project to 6 new countries, research the latest international business needs of SMEs and placement students in 31 countries and develop multimedia on-line training material that helps in increasing European SME business & increasing student employability for work & study placements.

This project that has been funded with support from the European Commission is developed by an international team represented by organisations from the following European countries: the United Kingdom (UK), Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Finland, Germany, Greece, Rumania, and Italy.
